metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4645 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibTIFF 4.4.0 has an out-of-bounds read in tiffcp in tools/tiffcp.c:948, allowing attackers to cause a denial-of-service via a crafted tiff file. For users that compile libtiff from sources, the fix is available with commit e8131125.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.8
libtiff-tools - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.8
libtiff5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.8
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: 0xnishit> This CVE has the same fix as CVE-2022-3599. CVE-2022-3599 has already been fixed across releases.

criterions.comment: tiff package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.9-5ubuntu0.8').
